data.title: How Is the Weather in New York in July?
data.meta_description: This post summarizes the weather in July in New York City, with tips on average temperatures, what to wear and things to do.
data.text:
This post summarizes the July weather in New York, with tips on what to wear, as well as things to do.

As local tour guides, we know that July is one of the best times for walking tours, because there's usually a lot of great, sunny weather.

And I am not just a tour guide. I'm also a retired meteorologist who has found a new way to put my experiences to work.

NYC HOTEL DEALS ON TRIPADVISOR - If you haven't already booked your accommodations.

AVERAGE TEMPERATURES

The month of July is characterized by warm temperatures, sometimes hot and humid with daytime average high temperature in the low to mid-80s F (26-29 C).

Expect overnight lows mostly in the mid to upper-60s F (17-21 C).

How Hot Does NYC Get in July?

About 6-7 days this month will see afternoon high temperatures at 90 F (32 C) or higher while a few of the cooler nights can dip down into the upper 50s F (14-15 C).

In the past, July has seen extremes here as high as 106 F (41 C) and as low as 52 F (11 C).

HUMIDITY

High temperatures aren't the only thing making NYC feel hot in July. Humidity is arguably more important.

New York City can get very humid in the summer months, and in July, you can expect a daily average of around 70% humidity.

This means that the heat index is often much higher than the recorded temperatures and you are likely to feel sweaty outdoors.

New Yorkers refer to this as muggy weather.

DOES IT RAIN MUCH IN JULY?

About 21 days this month will see either sunny skies or at least partly sunny skies.

Some rain or showers can be expected on about 10 days this month, however, only about 3 of these record significant rainfalls of 1/2 inch (13 mm) or more.

Most of the rain this month comes in the form of showers and thunderstorms which can be accompanied by strong gusty winds.

Due to the level of relative humidity, the weather forecast might show potential rain each day, but this doesn't actually happen in reality.

SEASONAL OUTLOOK - June to August 2026 New York City

There is a 76% chance for normal to above normal temperatures and a 72% chance for normal to above normal rainfall.

WHAT TO WEAR IN JULY

With warm, humid weather in New York in July, it is best to dress for summer.

We've made a list below of what to pack when visiting New York in July:

Disclosure: While our recommendations are always unbiased, we may receive a small share of sales through some of the links as an Amazon Affiliate below at no cost to you. See the full text.

1. Light-Weight Summer Clothes

Summer in New York is very warm, so you want to make sure to pack light!

Think cotton tops, shorts, skirts, and summer dresses. Be sure to pack sunscreen as well!

2. Comfortable Shoes

July is great for walking tours in New York!

Be sure to pack comfortable shoes like these from Saucony for the long days you'll be spending on your feet.

3. Umbrella

There will be a number of rain showers in July, so you will want to be prepared.

While it's too hot to pack a rain jacket, an umbrella will be perfect, like this compact umbrella by LifeTek.

July is one of the best times to visit NYC because warm weather, early sunrise, and late sunsets mean it's a great time for outdoor activities.
